turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Hapalopilus nidulans.
turn.1: Is there anything interesting about the Hapalopilus nidulans?
turn.2: The fruit bodies of "H. nidulans" are neurotoxic if ingested.
turn.3: Do they have any other uses?
turn.4: The toxin was identified as polyporic acid, a terphenyl compound first identified from a mycelial culture of the fungus in 1877.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: This chemical, present at 20–40% of the dry weight of the fruit bodies, inhibits the enzyme dihydroorotate dehydrogenase.
turn.7: Is there anything else that is important?
turn.8: It is found in other mushrooms, but in much lower amounts.
turn.9: Do they have any other uses?
turn.10: In a poisoning case reported in 1992, one German family who consumed "H. nidulans" experienced nausea, impaired movement, visual impairment, liver and kidney failure; symptoms began about 12 hours after consuming the mushroom.
turn.11: Did they have any other side effects?
turn.12: Additionally, the urine of all three poisoning victims temporarily turned violet.
